headline: Dimon says Trump tariffs may make 'the soft landing a little bit softer' instead of making the 'ship go down'
summary: The boss of the largest US bank expects to see the effects of tariffs in the coming months, and his hope is that the impact won't be dramatic.

headline: Morgan Stanley’s CEO Says Advisors Are ‘Underweight’ Alts
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick is looking to increase exposure to alternative investments and drive conversions from the company’s workplace advisory business to its financial advisors who serve individuals.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley’s CEO Says Advisors Are ‘Underweight’ Alts

headline: Morgan Stanley CEO 'super pumped' as deal pipelines stay resilient
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Morgan Stanley CEO Ted Pick told investors on Tuesday he expected the Wall Street bank to have a strong end to the quarter after U.S. tariff announcements paused activity in April.  "I'm super pumped up about the businesses," Pick said at an annual financial conference hosted by his bank.  Dealmaking and the calendar for equity capital markets are picking up, while deal discussions have stayed resilient and become more active in some areas, he added.

Dealmaking and the calendar for equity capital markets are picking up, while deal discussions have stayed resilient and become more active in some areas, he added.

headline: BlackRock, Goldman Scale Up Tax Trades in $3 Trillion SMA Boom

headline: Morgan Stanley markets $5 billion for Elon Musk-owned xAI in loans, bonds, sources say
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Morgan Stanley is marketing a $5 billion package of bonds and two loans on behalf of billionaire Elon Musk-owned xAI, at the same time as a falling out between the world's richest man and the U.S. president plays out in public, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.  As of last week, the bank started discussing a floating-rate term loan B at 97 cents on the dollar with a variable interest rate of 700 basis points (bps) over the SOFR benchmark rate, one person familiar with the matter said.  It is offering a second option, loan and bonds at a fixed rate of 12%, the person familiar added.

raw.headline: Morgan Stanley markets $5 billion for Elon Musk-owned xAI in loans, bonds, sources say
raw.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -Morgan Stanley is marketing a $5 billion package of bonds and two loans on behalf of billionaire Elon Musk-owned xAI, at the same time as a falling out between the world's richest man and the U.S. president plays out in public, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters.  As of last week, the bank started discussing a floating-rate term loan B at 97 cents on the dollar with a variable interest rate of 700 basis points (bps) over the SOFR benchmark rate, one person familiar with the matter said.  It is offering a second option, loan and bonds at a fixed rate of 12%, the person familiar added.
